context: Broadcom Corporation was a leading fabless semiconductor company in 2005, having expanded from broadband into wireless, networking, and Bluetooth chips. The company was competing in the growing mobile device and Wi-Fi markets.

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Wireless communications chip leader, major competitor in mobile technologies

competitors.name: Marvell Technology
competitors.notes: Fabless semiconductor competitor in storage and networking

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Major chipmaker with wireless and networking products

competitors.name: Texas Instruments
competitors.notes: Diversified semiconductor company competing in wireless and DSP

competitors.name: Atheros Communications
competitors.notes: Wireless networking chip company, later acquired by Qualcomm

competitors.name: Agere Systems
competitors.notes: Semiconductor company in wireless and storage, later merged with LSI

competitors.name: Silicon Laboratories
competitors.notes: Mixed-signal chip company in communications markets
